column5: trying to be like this guy Cliff? he is a two time international "guitar" playing champion!  <object width="425" height="350"><param name="movie" value="  Gerritt.

Hey now...couldn't find the 2004 champion? That year it was me...LOL. BTW...that guy is pretty cool....haha.

I dont air guitar...this is me playing something a little more mellow...hehe.

Cliff that was awesome brother!! thanks for sharing!  I took this from the news article..  " Ochi Yosuke received the highest score from a panel of judges in the final late Friday at the Teatria rock club in Oulu, near the Arctic Circle. Apart from the glory, he received a custom-made Flying Finn electric guitar worth $3,400."  Air Guitar pays.. LOL  Gerritt.

Yeah....what Brandon said  Always love hearing harmonics........first time I ever heard them was by Alex Lifeson as a teenager and HAD to learn how to do that Never got as good (or anywhere near for that matter) as you.....and did not keep up with it.  Excellent Cliff!!   Bill

Thanks everyone!!  That song took me a  year to learn....  bassboy - I hear what you said about Lifeson...I grew listening to Rush and when I first heard Red Barchetta, I wanted to learn harmonics as well!  The thing about this song, it's the picking hand that's harder than the harmonics themselves.
You would have gotten my vote Cliff - I pick you over that air guitar guy anyday.  Give us more!!
That's pretty awesome, That's one thing that I could never do, heck I still have problems doing the rubbing of the head and tummy at the same time. LOL
Bly and I are the air guitrist in the family we leave the real playing to Cliff
Clif,f  amazing. You don't need bait when you go fishing; just sit on shore play them a few tunes and they'll follow you home . . .   :clapping:  :clapping:

HI Cliff,  I have had a very busy day here at the store and very hectic 6 hours that we were open. I just sat down to take a break and decided to see what OFNer's are up to today. Well I would like to say that you hearing you playing the guitar was a very refreshing number that I much needed.  You have a great talent Cliff and I thoroughly enjoyed your music.  Regards, Sam
Just beautiful Cliff, very nice.  Joey

Thank you everyone...it took me a full YEAR to learn that song.  I'd learn to play a little of it...then practise it until I was happy with it...then learn the next little bit....and so on.  Glad you enjoyed it!
